meanings.definition: Boogies (noun): A slang term for nasal mucus.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the child wiped the boogies from his nose.
meanings.sent2: The tissue was full of boogies after the sneezing fit.
meanings.sent3: The boogies seemed to have a mind of their own, always appearing at the most inconvenient times.
meanings.sent4: The boogies clung to the tissue like tiny, sticky aliens.
meanings.sent5: The color of the boogies was surprisingly vibrant, resembling a rainbow.

meanings.definition: Boogies (verb): To dance energetically and with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone started to boogies when the music began.
meanings.sent2: She loves to boogies to her favorite songs in her room.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to boogies around the room, chasing an imaginary mouse.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the trees boogies in the wind, creating a mesmerizing dance.
meanings.sent5: The flames in the fireplace seemed to boogies and flicker in the dark.
